channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CT

item.title: Report X-2023110395
item.description:
Report X-2023110395

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-08
  • City: WATERTOWN
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE FOUND TO BE LEAKING BY IRREG TRAIN DRIVERS WHEN LOADING, UPON INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED CAPS WERE LOOSE ALLOWING FOR LEAKAGE

item.title: Report X-2023111266
item.description:
Report X-2023111266

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-22
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg was dropped and damaged during sortation causing the liquid to leak wetting the contents and carton. Pkg was placed leaking in an unauthorized unlined plastic bin damaging/contaminating the bin. The pkg in the bin was sent to QA where it was later taken to the HMPA for inspection and proper handling. DescribePack: Safety ring and friction lid failed when pkg was dropped. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg placed in bin.

item.title: Report X-2023110323
item.description:
Report X-2023110323

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-02
  • City: NORWALK
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS FOUND ON THE DMP TABLE IN THE GRAY SPILL TUB. THE CONTENTS HAD SPILLED AND LEAKED, SOAKING THE BOTTOM PORTION OF THE OUTER PACKAGING. RESPONDER USED THE DECISION TREE AND FOLLOWED THE RESPONSE SHEET TO PROCESS DAMAGE ACCORDINGLY. DURING CLEAN UP AND INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED OF THE 2 INTERNAL CONTAINERS ONE WAS PUNCTURED AND CAP LOOSE AND HAD SPILLED AND CONTAMINATED THE OTHER CONTAINER. BOTH WERE PROCESSED THRU DMP.

item.title: Report X-2023110553
item.description:
Report X-2023110553

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-06T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-27
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Automotive part placed in carton with absorbent padding and plastic bag. No Hazmat identifying markings on carton which is stained from the release of gasoline from the automotive part. Pkg was placed on a conveyor and sent to QA where it was later transferred to the HMPA for inspection and reporting. DescribePack: Loose fitting closures on 1 x 1 automotive fuel pump with gasoline still in the part. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Upon inspection at the HMPA the pkg was placed in properly lined salvage drum to await disposition.

item.title: Report E-2023110352
item.description:
Report E-2023110352

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-24
  • City: SOUTHINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: When unloading freight from trailer material handler discovered a jerrican that had been slightly punctured by other freight consequently contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was neutralized and cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured jerrican.
